newsitem.title: CANADA: Teck says owns no Bre-X shares.
newsitem.headline: Teck says owns no Bre-X shares.

text.p: Responding to market rumors, Canadian mining company Teck Corp said on Monday it had never held any shares in embattled Bre-X Minerals Ltd.

The company said in a statement that it did not normally comment on rumors, "but that a number of shareholders have called to ask about a persistent rumor from unknown sources to the effect that it does or did hold a share position in (Bre-X)."

Bre-X shares collapsed in value after the Calgary company said the size of its Busang gold discovery in Indonesia may have been overstated. Teck held talks with Bre-X last year about participating in the project but they were broken off.

Teck noted that its original talks were subject to due diligence checks and said it would still consider participating in the project if an audit under way of Bre-X's exploration work showed the deposit was economically mineable.

"Teck said that it would still be interested in a development contract should the current check drilling and assaying program being carried out confirm the existence of a viable, economic deposit," the company said.
